Translator.summary: NOTE Experimental The Translator interface of the {{domxref("Translator and Language Detector APIs", "Translator and Language Detector APIs", "", "nocode")}} contains all the associated translation functionality, including checking AI model availability, creating a new Translator instance, using it to create a translation, and more.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorSourceLanguage.summary: NOTE Experimental The sourceLanguage read-only property of the interface returns the expected language of the input text to be translated.

remarks.para: A Translator instance's sourceLanguage is set when creating it via a call.
-Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorSourceLanguage.value: A string specifying the source language. This will be a valid BCP 47 language tag (as specified in RFC 5646).

TranslatorInputQuota.summary: NOTE Experimental The inputQuota read-only property of the interface returns the input quota available to the browser for generating translations.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorInputQuota.value: A number specifying the available input quota.This number is implementation-dependant. For example, it might be if there are no limits beyond the user's memory and the maximum length of JavaScript strings, or it might be a number of tokens in the case of AI models that use a token/credits scheme.The only guarantee is that inputQuota - will be non-negative if there is sufficient quota to translate the text.

TranslatorTranslate.summary: NOTE Experimental The translate() method of the interface returns a translation of an input string.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorTranslate.returns: A that fulfills with a string containing the generated translation.

TranslatorDestroy.summary: NOTE Experimental The destroy() method of the interface destroys the Translator instance it is called on. It makes sense to destroy these objects if they are no longer going to be used, as they tie up significant resources in their handling.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorAvailability.summary: NOTE Experimental The availability() static method of the interface returns an enumerated value that indicates the availability of the AI model for the given Translator configuration.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorAvailability.returns: A that fulfills with an enumerated value indicating whether support is available (or will be available) for a given Translator configuration, or null if support could not be determined.Possible values include:

TranslatorCreate.summary: NOTE Experimental The create() static method of the interface creates a new Translator instance that can be used to translate text.

blockquote.para: The create() method requires transient activation, that is, it must be invoked in response to a user action such as a mouse click or button press.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorCreate.returns: A that fulfills with a Translator object instance.

TranslatorMeasureInputUsage.summary: NOTE Experimental The measureInputUsage() method of the interface reports how much input quota would be used by a translation operation for a given text input.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorMeasureInputUsage.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that fulfills with a number specifying the usage of the given input text.This number is implementation-dependant; if it is less than the , the string can be translated.

TranslatorTargetLanguage.summary: NOTE Experimental The targetLanguage read-only property of the interface returns the language that the input text will be translated into.

remarks.para: A Translator instance's targetLanguage is set when creating it via a call.
-Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

TranslatorTargetLanguage.value: A string specifying the source language. This will be a valid BCP 47 language tag (as specified in RFC 5646).

TranslatorTranslateStreaming.summary: NOTE Experimental The translateStreaming() method of the interface generates a translation as a .

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs
